essay.prompt: Describe an algorithm to segment the seashells from the image. How can morphological operations help to improve segmentation?

criteria.description: Proposes an algorithm for segmenting non-overlapping shells on a contrasting background using thresholding or color separation.
Explains how morphological filtering (erosion, dilation, opening, closing) improves segmentation quality and removes noise.
Provides a clear, step-by-step explanation with reasoning for each operation.

rubric.grading_notes: Partial credit for mentioning morphological operations without explaining their effect. Full credit for integrating them effectively into the segmentation pipeline.

essay.prompt: It has been decided that only texture will be used to classify the seashells. You may use either filter banks, Local Binary Patterns (LBP), or co-occurrence matrices to extract texture properties. Given a segmented image, describe an algorithm to classify a seashell. Where do the concepts of feature vector, distance function, and classifier fit in your algorithm?

criteria.description: Describes texture feature extraction using one of the suggested methods and explains its relevance.
Explains how texture features are formed into a feature vector and compared using a distance metric.
Describes how a classifier (e.g., k-NN or SVM) uses these feature vectors for training and prediction.
Logical structure and clear algorithmic flow from input to classification output.

rubric.grading_notes: Full credit requires integration of all three concepts—feature extraction, distance measurement, and classification—in a coherent algorithmic pipeline.

essay.prompt: The system should be extended to include shape features. What shape features could be useful for classifying the shells? How should one combine them with the texture features of the previous step? How should the algorithm be adapted to classify using both texture and shape?

criteria.description: Identifies relevant shape features and explains how they capture geometric differences between shells.
Describes how to combine texture and shape features via concatenation, normalization, or weighting.
Proposes classifier or feature scaling modifications to integrate multimodal data.
Provides a well-organized, conceptually sound discussion of combining multiple feature types.

rubric.grading_notes: Award partial credit for identifying correct shape features without discussing integration. Full credit for coherent fusion strategy and algorithmic justification.

notes_for_integration.formatting: JSON-only structured output for automated ingestion.
